name: Channel degradation
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Bed is stable, with no active incision disconnecting floodplain unless minor incision is normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Extract cross sections from LiDAR or survey data to compare bed elevation to the floodplain and locate active headcuts.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: No active downcutting. Bed elevation is stable.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Noticeable incision or one or two moderate headcuts that reduce floodplain access.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Severe channel-wide incision with multiple major headcuts.

references: USGS 3DEP LiDAR cross sections and hillshade
